main event: Sightings of a circular object, about 20 feet in diameter, that remained in the same position for 15-20 minutes before disappearing gradually in Minot, North Dakota on August 8, 1958. The object appeared white or light in color with no exhaust or propulsion noted.
interesting points: A circular object of significant size, about 20 feet in diameter, remained stationary for a considerable duration of 15-20 minutes, which is highly unusual for conventional aircraft.
The observation was made by Lieutenant Shultz of the station, adding credibility to the report.
No exhaust or propulsion was noted, indicating unconventional characteristics of the observed object.
There were SAC bombers in actual operation in the area, leading to initial confusion and assessment of the UFO as a normal aircraft before its unconventional behavior became apparent.
The Air Defense Command Center at Colorado Springs also concurred with the report, adding further weight to the sighting.
sighted object: circular object, approximately 20 feet in diameter
witnesses: Lieutenant Shultz, civilians from Air Force Interceptor Radar, and Air Defense Command Center
